body_html:
Yes. Maybe this is not an issue with GCC. By the way, let me just mention what I tried, for your information;

  1. CPU-only version of TensorFlow (r1.5) can be compiled normally with GCC 5.5.

  2. GPU-accelated version of TensofFlow needs older GCC (I use GCC 5.4) as nvcc, i.e.,

Please specify which gcc should be used by nvcc as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]:

and then I feed gcc-5.4 as nvcc (I maintain this local gcc in my home directory).

Thank you for your care and support.

body:
Yes. Maybe this is not an issue with GCC. By the way, let me just mention what I tried, for your information;

1. CPU-only version of TensorFlow (r1.5) can be compiled normally with GCC 5.5. 

2. GPU-accelated version of TensofFlow needs older GCC (I use GCC 5.4) as nvcc, i.e., 

Please specify which gcc should be used by nvcc as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]: 

and then I feed gcc-5.4 as nvcc (I maintain this local gcc in my home directory).


Thank you for your care and support.
